popt4jlib

Class ReentrantFunctionBaseMT

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.ReentrantFunctionBaseMT
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FunctionIntf

    public class ReentrantFunctionBaseMT
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    The class is a wrapper class for FunctionIntf objects, that keeps track of how many times a function has been evaluated, plus it forces threads asking for function evaluation to execute using a different FunctionIntf object, so that no calls from different threads execute on the same FunctionIntf object (this way, if the eval() call modifies only NON-static data members of the FunctionIntf object, there is no data race danger.)

    Notice that the underlying FunctionIntf object must have a no-arg constructor otherwise an exception will be thrown as no such constructor will be found in order to populate the array of FunctionIntf objects that this class' objects maintain.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReentrantFunctionBaseMT(FunctionIntf f, int nt)
      public constructor creates nt new f objects (using reflection) and stores them in an array.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double eval(java.lang.Object arg, java.util.Hashtable params)
      force function to be reentrant, as long as no STATIC data members are modified during evaluations, as no two threads can enter the eval() method on the same object simultaneously.
      long getEvalCount()
      return the total number of calls made to eval(x,p)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReentrantFunctionBaseMT

        public ReentrantFunctionBaseMT(FunctionIntf f,
                       int nt)
        public constructor creates nt new f objects (using reflection) and stores them in an array. Threads with a (global) id in the set {0,...nt-1} calling the eval(x,params) method of this object (with the params map containing an entry <"thread.id", Integer n> so that 0 <= n.intValue() < nt will run concurrently, but threads with different ids (specified in the params map) will run sequentially.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf
        nt - int the number does not have to be equal to the total number of threads in the system, and can be anything greater than or equal to zero.

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object arg,
          java.util.Hashtable params)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        force function to be reentrant, as long as no STATIC data members are modified during evaluations, as no two threads can enter the eval() method on the same object simultaneously.

        Parameters:
        arg - Object
        params - Hashtable
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arg is illegal for the function

        public long getEvalCount()
